first_reading.title: Book of Revelation
first_reading.text:
[[Ap 1,1]]The revelation of Jesus Christ, which God gave to him, to show his servants what must happen soon. He made it known by sending his angel to his servant John,
[[Ap 1,2]]who gives witness to the word of God and to the testimony of Jesus Christ by reporting what he saw.
[[Ap 1,3]]Blessed is the one who reads aloud and blessed are those who listen to this prophetic message and heed what is written in it, for the appointed time is near.
[[Ap 1,4]]John, to the seven churches in Asia: grace to you and peace from him who is and who was and who is to come, and from the seven spirits before his throne,
[[Ap 2,1]]"To the angel of the church in Ephesus, write this: 'The one who holds the seven stars in his right hand and walks in the midst of the seven gold lampstands says this:
[[Ap 2,2]]"I know your works, your labor, and your endurance, and that you cannot tolerate the wicked; you have tested those who call themselves apostles but are not, and discovered that they are impostors.
[[Ap 2,3]]Moreover, you have endurance and have suffered for my name, and you have not grown weary.
[[Ap 2,4]]Yet I hold this against you: you have lost the love you had at first.
[[Ap 2,5a]]Realize how far you have fallen. Repent, and do the works you did at first. Otherwise, I will come to you and remove your lampstand from its place, unless you repent."

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke
gospel.text:
[[Lc 18,35]]As Jesus approached Jericho a blind man was sitting by the roadside begging,
[[Lc 18,36]]and hearing a crowd going by, he inquired what was happening.
[[Lc 18,37]]They told him, "Jesus of Nazareth is passing by."
[[Lc 18,38]]He shouted, "Jesus, Son of David, have pity on me!"
[[Lc 18,39]]The people walking in front rebuked him, telling him to be silent, but he kept calling out all the more, "Son of David, have pity on me!"
[[Lc 18,40]]Then Jesus stopped and ordered that he be brought to him; and when he came near, Jesus asked him,
[[Lc 18,41]]What do you want me to do for you? He replied, "Lord, please let me see."
[[Lc 18,42]]Jesus told him, "Have sight; your faith has saved you."
[[Lc 18,43]]He immediately received his sight and followed him, giving glory to God. When they saw this, all the people gave praise to God.

psalm.text:
[[Ps 1,1]]Blessed the man who follows not 
the counsel of the wicked 
Nor walks in the way of sinners, 
nor sits in the company of the insolent,
[[Ps 1,2]]But delights in the law of the LORD 
and meditates on his law day and night.

[[Ps 1,3]]He is like a tree 
planted near running water, 
that yields its fruit in due season, 
and whose leaves never fade. 
Whatever he does, prospers.

[[Ps 1,4]]Not so, the wicked, not so; 
they are like chaff which the wind drives away.
[[Ps 1,6]]For the LORD watches over the way of the just,
but the way of the wicked vanishes.
